about_the_game:
Dear railway enthusiasts.


It is with awe and pride that we are pleased to present you the railway simulator you have been dreaming of.

TractionSim is a new generation post-Soviet railway simulator, created with unprecedented attention to detail and striving for maximum realism. We don't just give you the chance to drive a train, we immerse you in the enchanting atmosphere of the railway. Immerse yourself in the world of trains in an exciting simulator where there are no limits!

TractionSim is a revolutionary project that takes into account the problems and shortcomings of well-known railway simulators. Unlike others, where the railway equipment of the post-Soviet countries is presented in the form of homemade modifications, here it forms the main part of the game.

What you can expect:


  • Ultra-realistic AAA-level graphics, created using the latest technologies. Detailed models, the surrounding world animated with photogrammetry, weather effects and dynamic lighting create a unique atmosphere.
  • Detailed locomotives, carriages, stations and landscapes of the 80's era.
  • Accurate simulation of all train systems, including steering, braking, traction and more.
  • A variety of routes, from busy city stations to quiet rural landscapes.
  • Full interaction with the surrounding world.
  • Realistic weather system that affects your train control.
  • Career, in which you will go from a beginner to a seasoned professional.
  • Multiplayer, allowing you to play with friends and other players from around the world.
  • Route and rolling stock editor.

In TractionSim, you can play as:


  • A driver: Operate locomotives, run trains on schedule, follow signals, and ensure safe operation.
  • A dispatcher: Coordinate train movements, control switches and signals, and solve complex tasks in real time.
  • A track worker: Monitor the condition of the tracks, carry out repairs, and ensure the smooth operation of the railway.
  • A carriage attendant: Form trains, monitor the loading and unloading of carriages, and ensure the safety of the cargo.
  • A conductor: Create a comfortable atmosphere for passengers, maintain order in the carriage, and provide assistance on the way.
  • An electrical engineer: Service the electrical equipment of trains and infrastructure, troubleshoot problems, and keep systems in working order.
And this is not an exhaustive list! The simulator offers many other interesting roles, each with its own unique tasks and responsibilities.
Stay tuned for more news about our project. Subscribe on our social media and add our game to your Steam wishlist!
